Male.description: Male Steller's Eiders have a buffy (not black) breast and a longer tail than Long-tailed Ducks.

Male and female.description: Female Steller's Eiders have less white on the face than female Long-tailed Ducks and they have dark (not white) rear ends. Males have buffier bellies than male Steller's Eiders.

Breeding male and female.description: Male Harlequin Ducks have a dark gray (not buffy) belly and a chestnut patch on the side that male Steller's lack. Female Harlequin Ducks have 2 white spots on the face that female Steller's lack.

Breeding male.description: Male Northern Pintails have a brown head, not white like Long-tailed Ducks and gray, not buffy sides.

Female.description: Female Northern Pintails are paler overall than female Steller's Eiders. Females don't have white patches on the face like female Steller's Eiders.
